decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token, which can quickly close out the game. It includes cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith to search for the necessary pieces, as well as utility cards like Swords to Plowshares for removal. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Mox Diamond and Elvish Reclaimer to quickly get the combo pieces onto the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through the powerful synergy of its combo pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a combo involving Thassa's Oracle and Paradigm Shift to win the game on the spot by milling the library and having Thassa's Oracle enter the battlefield to win. The deck utilizes cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Faerie Seer for disruption, while also having protection spells like Force of Will and Stifle to protect the combo. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and Patron Wizard helps with controlling the game. The mana base is primarily Islands with some utility lands to support the game plan.

The primary strategy of this deck is to maintain control over the game through disruption, removal, and card advantage. By using a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive abilities like Stifle, the deck aims to interact with and answer the opponent's threats while protecting its own win conditions. The deck also includes card draw and selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent access to its key cards. Overall, the BUG Control deck focuses on managing the board and resources to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana and efficiently cast a high number of spells in a single turn to build up storm count and win the game with either Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot. The deck employs a variety of rituals, mana-producing artifacts, cantrips, and tutors to assemble the necessary combo pieces. It also includes disruptive elements like Duress and Veil of Summer to protect the combo from opposing interaction. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck by providing a creature that synergizes with the overall game plan.

This Legacy Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, while disrupting opponents with counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck's aggressive strategy is supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, and card draw/filtering spells like Ponder and Brainstorm. By aggressively applying pressure, countering threats, and controlling the board, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents, utilizing the Canadian Threshold archetype to its fullest potential in a 1 vs 1 format.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Shardless Agent and Crashing Footfalls and powerful cascade spells like Violent Outburst. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to control the game. Lórien Revealed is used to draw cards and maintain card advantage, while Minsc & Boo, Timeless Heroes provide additional pressure and support. The deck's mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana access for its spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with taxing effects while using aggressive creatures to apply pressure. It also utilizes flicker effects to gain value from entering the battlefield triggers. The companion Yorion provides additional value by blinking permanents. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game while efficiently dealing with threats through a mix of disruption, removal, and aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on using powerful discard spells like Grief to disrupt the opponent's hand while setting up graveyard interactions with Entomb and Reanimate to cheat out big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly assembling its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on efficiently disrupting opponents while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By taxing opponents' spells with Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and using disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic, the deck aims to control the board and slow down opponents' game plan. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures onto the battlefield quickly, while efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and synergy with the deck's flickering abilities.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Murktide Regent, and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Orcish Bowmasters, while also generating card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm. It also utilizes a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and counterspells like Stifle to keep the opponent on the back foot and push for a quick victory.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disruption and aggression, with cards like Grief and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Preacher of the Schism to apply pressure on the board. The deck also includes reanimation spells like Reanimate to bring back powerful creatures like Sheoldred. With a mix of control elements and aggressive threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while disrupting their strategy. The deck also includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain to help maintain card advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy Goblins deck is to quickly swarm the board with aggressive Goblin creatures and overwhelm the opponent with their speed and efficiency. The deck focuses on playing powerful Goblin tribal synergy cards like Muxus, Goblin Grandee and Goblin Ringleader, while also utilizing mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox. By combining powerful aggressive creatures with quick mana generation, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a relentless assault throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Sedgemoor Witch and Grief, supported by disruptive cards like Swords to Plowshares and Dark Ritual. By efficiently reanimating creatures and using cards like Chain of Smog and Ephemerate for advantage, this Aggro Deadguy Ale deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent, while also having answers to threats with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker. With a solid mana base including Wasteland and Karakas, this deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells such as Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Shallow Grave. By using cards like Entomb and Grief to put creatures directly into the graveyard, the deck can quickly and efficiently set up powerful combos with creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats early in the game, taking advantage of the opponent's lack of resources to quickly close out the game.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Grief and Entomb, and then bring them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. By utilizing cards like Force of Will and Daze for protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Dauthi Voidwalker and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colored requirements and provide disruption through Wasteland and Undercity Sewers.

The deck focuses on quickly getting high-powered creatures into play by utilizing a combination of graveyard manipulation and reanimation spells. It capitalizes on disrupting the opponent's strategy with disruptive creatures like Grief and Orcish Bowmasters, while also protecting its game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and efficient card draw like Brainstorm and Ponder. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, while also utilizing cards like Entomb and Reanimate to bring them back from the graveyard multiple times throughout the game.
